thread.title: 'Britain NEEDS us’ says China as Tories roll out red carpet for President to beg for cash
thread.title_full: 'Britain NEEDS us’ says China as Tories roll out red carpet for President to beg for cash

title: 'Britain NEEDS us’ says China as Tories roll out red carpet for President to beg for cash
text:
'Britain NEEDS us’ says China as Tories roll out red carpet for President to beg for cash 'Britain NEEDS us’ says China as Tories roll out red carpet for President to beg for cash BRITAIN needs Chinese investment for vital infrastructure and business development, according to the country's ambassador, as David Cameron pulls out all the stops to impress China's head of state on his visit to the UK. PUBLISHED: 10:55, Mon, Oct 19, 2015 | UPDATED: 11:14, Mon, Oct 19, 2015 GETTY Xi Jinping is arriving in the UK on October 19 
President Xi Jinping today arrives in Britain with his wife ready to receive non-stop lavish treatment for the duration of their four-day stay, with the hope China will agree to pour billions of pounds of investment into UK projects. 
The Government hopes to seal a "golden" relationship with China and has organised a packed diary of five-star events for Mr Xi and his wife Peng Liyuan, including a stay with the Queen at Buckingham Palace, a luxury state banquet and dining with the Prime Minister at Chequers. 
Ahead of the visit, China's ambassador to the UK, Liu Xiamong said: "The UK has stated that it will be the Western country that is most open to China. 
"This is a visionary and strategic choice that fully meets Britain's own long-term interest." Related articles
